title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no listing of children nodes. After creating a new data set without an SQL statement, if the new data source does not have any database, table, or column information, the children node listing is not displayed. This behavior persists even when closing and reopening the data set editor.
SR:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. Ensure that the new data source does not have any database, table, or column information.
3. Open the data set editor page in the query tab.
4. Change the data source for the data set.
5. Verify that there is no children node listing displayed.
6. Close the data set editor.
7. Reopen the data set editor.
8. Verify that the children node listing is still not displayed.
